LRolPJdwmif4Cm9P0V3W2w.text: First let me qualify that I wish there was a 3.5 star option.  Also despite the criticism of this review- I will still support this establishment for their amazing vision!  Having said that, I do wish this place was more consistent.  Whether you order the Kung Pao Chkn from the regular menu (10.99) or the all day combo menu (7.99) you disappointingly get the exact same amount.  I was excited for the drumsticks but this week they were over cooked and greasesticks.  Veggies always taste fresh and your food isnt drowned in cornstarch filled sauces- but I just find the value for the prices are very inconsistent.  It cost me over 22 bucks for a combo and drumsticks-  Perhaps offer more options for customers that may want to try an app without paying a price that is significantly higher than main courses.

OTOgNVhY4xz7okvamXSnig.text: We heard that they recently went completely vegetarian and had to go and check it out.  They have tons of vegan options!  We ordered the Peking duck, the fish in tomato and mushroom sauce, and the kung pao chicken.  We also had an order of potstickers.  Everything tastes very fresh and delicious!  I think the crowd favorite was the Peking duck.  Everything was reasonably priced, we didn't have to wait long, and the people working there were very friendly.  If I lived in Charlotte, I would be there all the time!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kung pao chicken combination plate
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peking duck
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veg fish with tomato and mushroom sauce

8M1dfzEIoSsPhp6qMUtChw.text: This place is amazing! We had the vegetable and the "pork" steamed buns, loved the veggie most. The Lemon Veg Fish appetizer was so flaky and delicious - I've had real fish that didn't even compare. Their rice dishes are great. Took home some Chinese donuts - super addictive and made fresh. The service was wonderful as well. Can't wait to try more!

T4ApGkmdzXI4N12u74nVuA.text: This was so good!!! Since I started veganism I've missed Asian takeout food so much, my friend and I tried this place and we were so surprised!! I had general tsos "chicken" with friend rice and an eggroll all for $8!! And it tasted like real chicken! It was so good and we are definitely going again!!

eHSuJwtrQkiVLDZ-Sw-SGQ.text: My absolute favorite restaurant ever. Love the employees here. Must get: udon w/ chicken and thai tea.

r_F2tyXE0PYTFPw_BPBZmQ.text: I had high hopes for this as it was my first time trying vegan Chinese and I could order anything on the menu, which never happens. But I was disappointed. I ordered the sesame chicken, which was okay, but kind of crunchy like real Chinese food. Which is something I always hated. My omni husband got the sweet and spicy chicken and veggies. There was barely any chicken and he didn't like it very much. He's very open minded and likes almost every fake meat he's tried. The owners were very nice and accommodating and made him a side order of sweet and sour chicken and it was disgusting. Sorry :( I feel bad because they were so nice. But we both tried it and spit it out. It was mushy. The spring rolls were good. I would probably go back and give it another chance. My meal was okay, and the owners were very sweet but over all I was disappointed. I still support them and appreciate their business.

083TFqS83i34VqWKBYOWkg.text: Yesterday night I got the sesame chikn all day combo and the flavors,textures and sight of it all brought me back sweet memories. The food was very delicious and tasty!  I also got the "shrimp" fried rice and BBQ veg meat and it was AMAZING as well! I will be back. I have been meat-free and Vegan since 2016 and I am impressed so far! Once you go Vegan you will not miss out on anything!

HvVs78GMowsvudsEaj8t_Q.text: This restaurant recently went 100% vegetarian. I've been waiting for a veggie Chinese restaurant in Charlotte for years and am so happy to finally have a good one. I had the wonton soup and kung pao chicken. It was heaven! I can't wait to go back. My only regret is that I ate my meal so fast I forgot to take pictures. The fake meat is so good I think the meat eaters will love it too. The owners are vegetarians and know what they are doing. Highly recommend!

xttzgzT3uzywAXTa4C2Xrg.text: Mama Wok recently went vegetarian - they have a ton of great options. The Hunan "Chicken" was absolutely delicious. The pan fried dumplings added a nice touch! The service was outstanding. Will be back! Amazing food!!!!

UDP9KTBpEq8M7h7RmKVBhQ.text: Love this place and AMAZING FOOD! So awesome that vegan options are marked on their menu. So proud of this place for being the first vegetarian Asian food in this area.

rFJKDulgRqZjwDnw52RW8Q.text: This is my favorite Asian restaurant in Charlotte. I started eating here before the place turned vegan and continue to eat there at least once a week. The food is amazing and extremely well priced, and the staff is so sweet. They make delicious food from the appetizers to dessert. I would recommend Ma Ma Wok to any person. The vegan aspect doesn't at all take away from the authenticity of the cuisine, if anything it's much better now knowing there was no harm in creating delicious food! Love this place!

nXtEGgjEEi6mK32kJ18Nsw.text: One of my new favorite spots. Always nice to have different options for food plus great service.  Just imagine all of your favorite Chinese entrees made with meat.. Must try this place if you live any where near here.

mwwBw1_j3cVDTDaLt4CHlw.text: Amazing food. Crazy how the fake meat has so much favor and texture! Anybody would be amazed by this place.

Y3-Qs6f8uvfSkmkxEm6NdA.text: The same better food and now they go green and meatless chicken shrimp etc... I still love the quality here instead all chineses restaurant around

0PGGmLJh1j-BgzLRR8Tqhw.text: Best Chinese I've ever had and even better, it's vegan! Charlotte is lacking in catering to vegans and this place is an answer. Everyone was extremely nice and the service was great.

QDUGIRU3XLE9OGrqZpd4Tg.text: Incredibly good, real tasting food. Would definitely recommend sweet and sour soup and General Tso's. The rice was not greasy paper rolls were crispy and flakey. My wife ordered orange chicken and you could actually taste the orange and it's zest in the sauce. They obviously care about their food and it shows. Definitely check these guys out because I left feeling full and healthy

NIDOCDQc4hvUu6YDvrri6A.text: I made the trek out to Ma Ma Wok from Huntersville because I kept hearing how good the food was! And it definitely didn't disappoint! They now serve vegetarian/vegan food but honestly my carnivore husband was very pleased. The orange veg. chicken was amazing, as was the lemon fish appetizer. Definitely try the spring rolls, they are crispy and delicious! Also the owners are really friendly and answer all your questions. Can't wait for my next excuse to go!

Pyip0vc8rWk9uIJPDTLp4Q.text: My husband and I are vegan and we miss some dining out on the weekends. We finally tried Ma Ma Wok yesterday and it is sooooooo good. Even a non-vegan would like it. I ordered the Kung Pao Chicken, my husband had the chicken Lo Main and we had some potstickers and spring rolls. Everything was delicious. One thing that I really liked is that the food was not too salty which can be the case in a lot of Chinese restaurants but it had a lot of flavor. We will definitely come back and try other dishes.

DfK-2hvKwt_9nl-6QQQA8w.text: My husband and I are trying to eat more meat free meals and decided to try this place.  It did not disappoint!  The food was delicious and fresh and I could not tell the beef and broccoli was vegetarian at all.  The steamed dumplings and lo mein were also delicious.  Looking forward to returning!

RRSlyFE_xdbOk4knevmv0A.text: Yes Yes Yes! This place is amazing! The staff is even better. Very friendly people. I will be back. 45 minuet drive. Still worth it.

2_l-dNH7skIq672eY2r5Cg.text: It's so refreshing to see this restaurant go fully vegan, and to finally have a fully vegan Chinese restaurant in Charlotte! It's rare that I can go out to a Chinese restaurant and be able to eat everything off the menu. Every time I've come here the food has been really good, and the servers are always so nice. Would definitely recommend checking it out

bv4GmJDA-VJuHQbFrZtdHQ.text: I am SO excited that they made the change to be vegan/vegetarian friendly. Guess what they have been vegan for years themselves!!! We got to try the ma po tofu & the veggie lo mein it was DELICIOUS! To all my Charlotte & surrounding area veggies lovers we need to support them...the staff is welcoming & will help you make the perfect meal selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

zfczRxnUBbOK4FOTJAzjqQ.text: It's vegetarian food. I really want to try vegetarian food after eating too much meat during the weekdays. It's good choice for weekend for me.

cexDRIcEWmJiQZ_5yrpGZA.text: Wow I was extremely impressed with the food here. It is absolutely delicious, reasonably priced, fast and the service is great. Definitely worth the drive to come out here. The menu had tons of options it was mind blowing!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. 100% vegan too!

e-TIGr77TPW0bjPr4bMvvQ.text: After coming across glowing reviews of this place in a FB group I finally met up with a friend of mine who is a carnivore for some lunch. Not only was the plate of food beautiful and delicious, but the owners are some of the nicest people we have ever met. They came over and talked to us about their food and prep as well as they offered to make us delicious fresh juice and that was also amazing. The spring rolls were rolled and cooled while we were there and for my friend who eats meat, he said he could easily give it up if everything was this delicious. Can't wait to take my wife this week. 40 mins away from my house and I will become a frequent patron.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

QYvoUqY5jKqP5D_D0TilDg.text: Ma Ma Wok re-opened as a vegetarian Asian restaurant on Aug 1, 2017. I just discovered them and ate there for lunch today. Everything they serve is vegetarian and most menu items are vegan. I had the beef & broccoli and it was fantastic. The broccoli was not overcooked; it had a crunch that made me happy. The beef was very realistic. In fact, I pondered if it was real meat and reminded myself that it is an entirely vegetarian restaurant. The sauce was a bit sweet, but that's normal these days. I got the fried rice, which had a slightly smoky flavor. Overall, it was a great tasting meal.   The prices are definitely higher than a normal Chinese restaurant, but they are in line with other vegetarian restaurants such as Bean. One advantage of this restaurant over a normal Chinese restaurant is not having to worry about your food cooking on the same griddle as meat and not having chicken wings fried in the same oil as your spring roll. The waitresses were all super nice and the place was very clean.   I'm very happy to have another vegetarian restaurant in Charlotte and looking forward to eating there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Back Side
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Front Side

By944iGFzcGpJULBghTEvQ.text: Today I purchased a groupon to use for this restaurant I sent my fiance in with the groupon to use and after 5 mins of them fumbling around with the groupon they clicked redeem and didn't give me the food! The lady lied and said she didn't click anything! I soon called in to yell at the lady because the groupon showed as used but there was no food so I called in to demand to call groupon and they released my food. Why are you on groupon if you don't know how to use it!!!?! They also don't speak good English at all so they'll put up a fight just because they think they're right! Please don't believe the other reviews unless you really can't afford to eat at upper scale restaurants .. I don't know if they got mad and peed in my food or what but the food does NOT taste good it has a very off taste the lemon fish squares were extremely tiny and the rice was god awful like if you're really use to eating upscale food then don't try this place because you'll be able to notice the difference in quality. My fiance said this is a hole in the wall place so I'm praying to not get sick from what I just ate!

I9xg1DccK7zPd4ahfbPh7w.text: My fiance and I bought a Groupon for this place and went last night. We are both vegan so we were excited to try. We were not disappointed! Mama Wok is fantastic!! The service was amazing, everybody was very friendly and did not give us any problems with our Groupon. Food came out fast and tasted so good! We had the steamed potstickers, steak with asparagus, and orange chicken for dinner and chinese donuts and thai tea for dessert. We loved it all!! We are excited to go back and try the other dishes!!

SqjnoSXcPVNELGU1XklCpA.text: Thanks for overcharging me for nothing. Seriously?!  For starters I ordered the "Crab Rangoon." As you probably know they are fried won tons stuffed with cream cheese and crab.... They had little to NO filling! Wtf?! (see picture)  My "Sweet & Sour Chicken was burnt and hard. (see picture)  I ordered extra sauce for "The 4 Seasons" entree, I was charged but did not receive hardly any sauce at all. (see picture)  This place is terrible. I have low standards for Chinese restaurants, but this place is awful.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt and inedible sweet and sour chicken
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. No sauce when I was charged for extra sauce for the 4 seasons
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. No crab/ cream cheese in the crab Rangoon

5FO5BRr4tueM5o2QB-UXBw.text: The food and amount of options in this place is amazing, I'm pretty sure both vegans and others will find something delicious. Absolutely not your typical Chinese restaurant, the food is prepared with high attention to detail and is super fresh. Service was great too, will come back for more!

VytYkGjmJRL3FXZtRLzHVA.text: We love this place. My wife and I are vegan and it is some awesome food. I took my parents out one day and they are definitely not vegan but they couldn't tell that it was a vegan restaurant. I try to make it up as much as I can but it is quite a drive currently. I understand they were not a previous vegan restaurant but they converted and I am glad they did.

UELQDE4uqdfbJ7acVbTaMw.text: quick service, friendly staff and the food was so good! hot and fresh, tried the spring rolls, so yum and also the veggie fried rice. would definitely go back!

JEsX6osC0VRDzX3Zoab2qQ.text: So the customer service is excellent they seem really sweet and attentive to my vegan needs lol which is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

Kn03s56bpuIbU_lzlzdevQ.text: Food was excellent. Tasted Chinese and didn't miss the meat. Although small and in a strip mall, obviously this is an authentic Chinese restaurant. The waitress and owner were very attentive and helpful to make sure we had a good experience. We particularly enjoyed the Thai Chai cold drink and sweet and sour veg dish.

7w8yFGZkV5JQST47pIizUQ.text: We loved this restaurant!  We ordered the fried wonton, potstickers, General Tso Chicken, noodles with chicken and the donuts, and everything was delicious!  Will definitely eat there again.

ISYymmN_cpiUNigUTzpZYQ.text: Love. Love. Love this place! Amazing vegetarian Chinese food! Good service. However, ordering from the website can be tricky since the (781) number isn't the actual number to the restaurant. They really need to fix that. Other than that, the spicy orange "chicken" is incredible! One of my favorite "pop in" spots in Ballantyne! They should also add delivery :-)

96SCg9a8B4TzdZLw91FELA.text: Mama Wok is a Great option if you are vegetarian or vegan.  Honestly, even if you're a meat eater, you'll love it.  You can get any traditional Chinese dish with vegan meat substitutes or tofu.  My favorite is General Tso Tofu!  Ownership is super friendly and accommodating. Do yourself a favor and give them a try. Soooo good!

wprx-Jnc8VV6MQc5L45Wvw.text: Sorry I really wanted to give better. This was my 3rd time eating here. I've been veg for almost 27 years so I'm not new to the changes they have made and I'm not one to compare to meat. I just think that for price and the quality and quanity it dosen't cut it. I don't mind paying more but make it a value. I just did Tofu with vegetables for lunch. I counted 5 thin slices of over fried tofu with just 2 broccoli and 3 celery. Come on y'all American Chinese food does not run a high food cost at all. Even the rice that came with it was small amount. The  Wonton soup was okay today. Sorry folks just now worth it to me. Just becuase I'm Vegan dosen't mean I haveto blindly love this place.

Ueyx4l0Dm1XfP3RFuhPEDw.text: Best fake meat dishes!  Excellent food. Good price.  We will be back. Great to find a good vegan restaurant.

tTRAmpn9nrud_YR7K7UiQQ.text: This place is a hidden gem! The food is always fresh and not as greasy as other Chinese restaurants. The owner is always available to answer any questions about the vegan menu.  My one issue is that most items are a mock meat. As a strict vegetarian, I'm not trying to replicate a meat taste. This is True for most Indians who are vegetarian. There aren't any descriptions of what these mock meats are (i.e. tofu, seitan, wheat gluten) so I don't venture out from just getting a basic tofu dish. If they just added a sheet to the menu with descriptions of the "meats" that would be very helpful and get me more comfortable with trying more items from the extensive menu.

J8BwvoLY2Cffqg_yqrasxg.text: Delicious. Pleasant room to walk in to.  Welcoming and helpful staff. For some reason not as much oil went into the preparation of my meal.  Something mainstream Asian joints should pick up on.  I will be back.

LbhOglUeANI4ehsFx_dLjQ.text: Great place for when we are craving vegan Chinese food! Singapore noodles were our favorite!

mLYzOF31GvdhB8oKXoPtAw.text: Everything at MaMa Wok is amazing. You literally can't go wrong. Make sure you order extra food to-go or you'll regret it!

ejubQejOgUz_38-vrawM6A.text: We have found that the fake meat is a little bit beyond our liking, but we do love the food we get from this place! The vegetables are very fresh and we dream of the spring rolls. Nice, conscientious staff. We're not even Vegan, but the quality and commitment of the restaurant have turned us into regulars when we're ready for a meat-break.

lEJY61qAWCuIaYHzKPCUNg.text: Incredible! Wonderful! I am so happy right now! This is my first visit to MaMaWok. I can only give stellar reviews on several points.  The hot and sour soup is delicious. It's always been a favorite soup for me, but have not had it since living in Charlotte,  because I eat a plant based diet. I'm so happy to have that flavor back!  The Peking Duck (I asked for their vegan version) is automatically one of my favorite things.  The people are beautifully kind. I really feel like a guest, not a customer.   Clean! I'm here late, near closing, and they are cleaning in places I know most restaurants don't. They are moving things and getting behind things. I just watched a man clean the door knobs to the rest room. Very impressed.  Whether you eat a plant based/cruelty free diet, or not, this is a "must try" restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing Vegan Peking Duck!

fUo8mFB1kIIDiVl3N4-NAg.text: Amazing vegan alternatives, and the sweetest people. Loved the spring rolls and the sweet & spicy sauce dish! Cute & clean little place, too. Definitely recommend for vegans, vegetarians, or those wanting to try something a bit different & healthier! Big portions, too.

sr6QAwa9xLgCtbTNZSGWMQ.text: Great vegetarian options! The atmosphere is very inviting though the place can be hard to find, it's right next to a gas station.  We were greeted by very friendly and family oriented people. They take great care into making sure that we are comfortable.   The food took a little time to get to, this all the more indicates that there's a lot of love in its preparation. Compared to its earlier dishes as a regular Chinese restaurant, I can definitely tell the difference in quality as a fully vegetarian restaurant. The ingredient and preparations are much lighter and healthier while maintaining a good sense of taste. I had a vegetarian curry chicken(imitation meat) and felt just as satisfied.   Overall 5 stars all the way, I would definitely come back to try more of their dishes! Great price for great vegetarian food!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily Special. Love it!
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. New dishes!!!
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ask for their specials! - Veg. Pork Bun

9wbFu6q_VzSaDoCF-QvgyQ.text: Excellent vegan options and superb service!  Definitely worth a trip here, even if it is out of the way. We had the spring rolls, string bean appetizer, orange peel veg meat, and a special noodle soup made with ginger and tomato.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. We had the spring rolls, string bean appetizer, orange peel veg meat, and a special noodle soup made with ginger and tomato.
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. We had the spring rolls, string bean appetizer, orange peel veg meat, and a special noodle soup made with ginger and tomato.

6uJawq0nkT0GNfp4Ie4CfA.text: Fresh, flavorful vegan food in a charming setting. Lovely staff and amazing customer service, all are very knowledgeable about what goes into the food. We're thrilled to have found this gem right here in Ballantyne! Looking forward to being regular customers. Highly recommend.

3D1zcRXeynze96lZCFqaiA.text: Absolutely terrible. Entree came with less than 3 ounces of chicken. Meat was almost a shaved consistency. One of the worst places I have eaten for Chinese.

vfHm_LkJbYTW1nsAjDmNqA.text: Fully vegan Chinese restaurant in Ballantyne area! I usually get general tso chkn with fried rice or lo mein & their spring rolls are amazing too.   Dine in or carryout with super friendly staff.... you must try them out.

6ccjZAnli5SrUqF2tYMsDw.text: We arrived ten minutes before closing and we were only able to get take out.  So, we got fast take out.   Had to make a quick decision, so we both got tofu dishes. We were drawn here based on my reading a Yelp review that told of it being vegan and vegetarian.  Their menu includes sesame chicken, but all meat is vegetarian.   There were a lot of vegan and vegetarian offerings on the menu.  Seemed entirely authentic as two Chinese women helped us at the counter and their English was difficult to understand.   For a minute, I thought I was in China.   Eating Chinese food at home at 10:00 pm was certainly out of the box for us.  The food ended up being just so so. There was a lot of grease. Perhaps we are so used to Thai and Vietnamese food now and this just seemed not as healthful.    I will give them the benefit of doubt since we poked our heads in the door just before closing.  It probably was not their best culinary performance.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

SPHoe1reFHUMzX0AAz5ijw.text: Hands down most delicious vegan Chinese food around Charlotte!! Our family who isn't vegan enjoyed it as well!

4jZWc49WvQU-M-HW3xGtpQ.text: Discovered this place from a yelp search. Found a great opportunity to try them out for Father's day. Noticed the place was very clean. Waitress was very friendly. Menu items was very familiar but everything here was veganized! I ordered the General Tso "chicken" which was unbelievable and my wife ordered the "beef" and veg plate. My wife was not too convinced but I enjoyed my plate. Look forward in returning and trying something else in the menu.

BL-GcSKcE_VGb6tWJxzeFg.text: The food here is so good! I have been a vegetarian for many years and have never had Chinese food this good. We ordered the drum sticks as an appetizer and they were unexpected but very tasty. I ordered the spicy orange peel "meat" with broccoli--it was fantastic! If you're not a vegetarian or vegan, don't be deterred--the food is truly delicious!

rwuYFsGXhmxC12ba9RrUIQ.text: My first time here was yesterday and I fell in LOVE With the place. The two ladies were wonderful that worked there. It's hard to find vegan items on a menu but their entire menu is vegan and everything was phenomenal!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

gosVCBI2mnQQ_uJ2_wYX1g.text: If your looking for your Chinese American takeout/restaurant, this is the place. Not fancy, just good food, and it's vegan! The prices are super reasonable, and the staff is kind and humble. Skip the meat tonight, and treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

S7lzp0QMxUGcyAQJOKwt9Q.text: Oh my god!!! I have been a vegetarian for 6 years, and honestly Chinese food has never been the same... this place is amazing! The best chinese I think I have ever had!! And the service was second to none!! The sweetest lady took such good care of us even though we came 20 minutes before close! I am so far passed impressed and I encourage everyone , carnivore or not to give this place a try. They have created a loyal returning customer!

UBNUoMO55JNm11QLsXtC0A.text: Excellent vegetarian and vegan options, so delicious that even meat eaters can enjoy! My boyfriend and I don't eat meat and usually have to resort to tofu and veggies at Chinese restaurants, which is tasty but nothing special. But then we heard of the amazing array of meatless Chinese cuisine at Ma Ma Wok and had to try! We absolutely loved it!! First off, the staff was all very friendly which is big in my book. Then we had delicious lettuce wraps with vegetarian ham. We then had two vegan chicken entrees. They really tasted like chicken and the sauces had wonderful flavor.   Please keep an open mind. This food is very delicious and I used to eat meat. Animal products do not need to be part of your meal. If you read about the treatment of innocent animals on factory farms, the environmental impact of meat and dairy consumption (global warming) and all the hormones and junk that goes into most animal products, you can then see that eating a more plant based diet is the way of the future.

28ICin50bIWhivYBov6bSA.text: This is my favorite restaurant. If you don't eat meat and like Chinese food it's the best place for you. The people are very nice there and the food comes fast.

15lQ3NwI7LFkEMUhPBNGdw.text: 12/1/18- Ate again last night and We love this place as the food is always fresh and delicious. Staff is always friendly and OP. Coming from NYC Chinatown Mecca,  I recommend these Abundance attracts greater abundance ideas:  1- try to make more things Organic on menu!  2- Portions sizes are ok but should be LARGER and more  generous for the price, and quality of ambience . 3- Like many restaurants offer today ...Create a Mama Wok loyalty club for every $150 get $10 back.  Being generous attracts more generosity.    4/23/18 ~We have been trying out different things consistently here , and as such the only qualms I have besides not being organic for the prices are portion sizes~ We used to believe REDBOWL was pricey but you always always received a great portion for each dish- although the "faux chicken/meat" with asparagus here is one of the more expensive dishes,imho,  it gives you like very little  of any of the faux anything ...mostly vegetables for not a faux price!  Beings business man myself I always prefer feeling like my meal was worth it when we eat out vegan or not   We have had take out here twice recently ... ~ Food is very good. Tasty and flavorful. ~ portion sizes are average. ~ Vegan quality is good, and fresh! ~  interior is a typical basic Chinese restaurant. ~No eggs dairy, msg or oversalty. -  staff is friendly.  ~ Business practices- hmmm - On this last take-out order of $60, we ordered "brown rice" with everything only to arrive 30 mins later to pick up , and find out that they didn't have any brown rice for ALL 4 of our entrees ...only whita rice! No phone call or warning or courtesy-  So you be the judge?! I will Update in the near future based on more experiences.

dOeCKfla9oAeyDjufMyL9A.text: I was looking for quick Chinese food so I did not have a chance to read through all the reviews prior to ordering from this place. By the time I had realized that it was a vegan place, it was too late and my order was in. They should indicate in the name of the restaurant that it is a vegan place, because without reading the Yelp reviews, it looks like they offer vegan OPTIONS, not that vegan options are the ONLY options. Needless to say, I was a bit disappointed when I ate my "meat." I had the Sesame Chicken combo, which comes with broccoli and fried rice for $7.99. It's a great portion, but the "meat" tasted like tofu with every bite. The fried rice was also too dry and lacked flavor. Even the boyfriend noticed that the meat did not taste right. He had the General Tso's Chicken combo, also $7.99. It tasted like puffs of air. Staff was very nice and polite, and they were very quick with our orders, but I wish it was made much more obvious that the cuisine is vegan - name it something along the lines of "Ma Ma Vegan Wok."

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame Chicken Combo
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. General Tso Chicken Combo

DygUUeOWTdNN37obvWS6qg.text: Amazing ! Everything is vegan but doesn't taste that way! Get the drumsticks, so good!  They were my favorite ! also got the kung pow chicken with beef. I prefer the chick n over the beef  but both were delicious . Also got the pork buns ! Thank u ma ma !

Dj_vT65eypkVTHMZECL5oQ.text: Sooo good that they have an all vegan Chinese restaurant! Shared with my husband the pork buns, wonton soup, and sesame chicken, and "steak" lo mein with the sugar donuts for dessert. Everything was delicious but beware lots of oil which led for a few rough days after LOL. Worth it tho also the donuts come in a big portion

3TE2WgBVj1jlyP6MFJd4eQ.text: Aww, I was really hoping to like this place. Even if I hadn't the read the promising reviews prior to eating here, I expected better. As a a pesca-vegan, I wanted to surprise my mom by not telling her the meat was fake. But this inedible concoction was not the kind of surprise I intended.   Sorry, mom.   Perhaps we shouldn't have arrived 15 minutes before lunch closing.  At the very least, the food should match the menu description. Their sweet n' sour "chicken" contained potato instead of pineapple (as listed). Whyyy. My dish contained a minuscule amount of UFOs (Unidentified Food Objects), making this a particularly tragic substitution choice.   My mother's cashew "chicken", on the other hand, was worse--and didn't even have cashews. The scarce amount of chicken she did have looked like shaved tofu, opposed to more normalized bits of chicken or even fake meat, which I can attest to in Los Angeles. 75% of her order was vegetables, unlike mine, which she describes as "a cross between sinewy muscle and tree branches."  Ma Ma Wok gives plant-based a whole new meaning. Ma ma, run.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Picture looks better than actual taste.

Ta7G6pT7iTaYDsx-b4TAFQ.text: This is the BEST place. I will drive 20 minutes out of my way just to eat here. You'd never know it was vegan, so everyone can enjoy it but also so amazing to have a vegan place with such delicious food. You also get so much food for the price- it's lasted me 3 meals before. Also the BEST donuts.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy orange chicken!!! My favorite on the menu so far!

lLt0VlXuikgqynrdpxaANg.text: I can't think of enough synonyms for 'bland' to describe the food from here. I saw all these great reviews and expected more but I guess no one here has heard of seasoning before? Or maybe I went on a bad day. I've never had a more bland meal in my life. Super disappointed because it's in such a convenient location for me.   I tried the lemon fish, tofu rice, and broccoli.

RuXds_0nkSrxAm-nGIX_Ng.text: I went for dinner with my girlfriend and we had a very nice time. Though the servers didn't speak good English, they were very friendly and helpful. Our food came out quickly and not a single dish was a disappointment. I would highly recommend something off the noodles menu.  The fact that everything is vegetarian is a nice touch. If it wasn't specified, you might not even notice that all the meat is "fake."   I'll probably go back again soon, for takeout or to dine in.

TKpJJp5CWPPs2trAQMtusg.text: Definitely worth the drive out to the Ballantyne area. Same feel and look of your typical Chinese restaurant. Heard great things about the lo mein noodles. My favorite of course is the rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. House fried rice with mock shrimp, chicken, pork and beef.
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Beef&#34; with Broccoli
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best thing ever! I love Chinese so to find a vegan alternative was so important. The &#34;house&#34; fried rice is a favorite.

lnpiBbm49EQHuaakmyU9tA.text: This place is DELICIOUS!! Friendly staff and great food. The Vegan fried chicken was to die for! Everyone really enjoyed their meals. Check this place out!!

92C43Y9rEHJJm1guzJDEuA.text: Vegan. Chinese. Food. Yes!!!!   We have been here several times now and have tried several dishes.   The lettuce wraps have kept us coming back! We have ordered them 3x now. One time we tried the bbq ribs appy but were quickly regretting our decision to forgo the lettuce wraps. They're hard to beat.   Yes to house made kimchi, it is good on everything!   Our favorite combination is ordering the Udon Noodles with "beef" and asking very nicely for something off-menu... mu shu pork.  The cabbage and veg from the mu shu seems to go perfectly on top of the udon noodles. The are meant to be together in our hearts and in our stomachs.   We have also enjoyed the special noodle soup (see specials and drawing on the table), the dry sauteed green beans, and the asparagus chicken and veg dish.   The only 'miss' for me was the zhajiungmian (might be spelling it wrong) on the specials board. It was noodles with a thick sauce on it and I really prefer dishes with more veggies in them. Not something I'll revisit... we have a huge menu to get through!   Oh and my Omni brother in law is obsessed with the sesame "chicken". Kudos

EZnjadCRoMPQV8OXKdRn6A.text: This was one of the first restaurants I tried when I moved to Charlotte. If I wasn't health-conscious I could eat here every day. My favorite dish is the house lo mein and I love the wonton soup. The staff are very friendly and welcoming.

kLiqRuPEK3vb9XhKevqStA.text: MUST TRY - SOOOOO GOOD. I have never had all vegan Chinese food like this place. The flavors were incredible and the textures were so on point. I had the Thai tea to drink, also very good. Rainbow soup - yes. Get the drumsticks and the pork buns!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

1onV_pvd2lDYFGHTjDfn9g.text: My All Time Favorite Spot In Charlotte.   For many reasons..  1. 100% Vegan = No guilty food coma afterwards  2. Portion size is literally perfect 3. Quality food!(The rice was so great along with the sauce for the sesame chicken. Also IT TASTES JUST LIKE CHICKEN) 4. Great service everytime I go 5. They're the ONLY vegan Chinese spot in Charlotte   You need to try this place out because it's so unique. Where else you gonna get sesame chicken and rice without feeling like trash after?? Delicious.

4ut_-6UzYX3xI5XvtYyP3A.text: Oh my goodness! I love this place! So happy to have another ALL VEGAN restaurant!! The staff is so nice & the food came quickly. I had the Hot & Sour Soup to start and it was great...plenty of veggies and some freshly snipped cilantro--delicious! My spring roll was good, too. My family got the "chicken" drumsticks--very authentic!! And tasty! The Seitan "chicken" was very good and I like their rice.  My daughter enjoyed her vegetable fried rice and my parents got what they always order: a rice noodle dish that has vegetables and 3 "meats"--shrimp, beef and I forgot the last. It's so much that they always share. Ma Ma Wok rocks!!  (My only complaint: it was very warm eating in the restaurant...but it was in the high 90s that day...)

WetW_i6tBHrS79Va1fGb2g.text: THE BEST CHINESE FOOD IN CHARLOTTE AND ITS ALL VEGAN !!! Absolutely love . I live in concord so it's about a 45 minute drive, so I really wish they would open a location closer to north Charlotte .

yVy7-kuSGwkH33cab0pL_g.text: I've been 4 times and the different items are consistently good, and they're fast with good service

E0q4WgaCK9B5bnN9tAJiIg.text: TL;DR: all-vegan, tasty food with fresh and crisp veggies, and kind, helpful owners. Choose tofu if faux meats are not your thing, and keep in mind that sodas come in plastic bottles and their takeaway containers are Styrofoam. Sugg: order the dumplings!  Vegan here, I would absolutely come again. Visited for a weeknight dinner with my omnivorous SO, who loved each dish just as much as I did (he's familiar with faux meats from my cooking, so no surprises there).  App: The dumplings are very tasty, clearly handmade.   Entree: We ordered the "chicken" curry by staff recommendation, which had many lovely veggies, some fried tofu, and some faux "chicken" slices. My SO ordered the kung pao "beef", which had a lot of broccoli and some peanuts. The faux "beef" had a bit of an anise hint to it, which isn't my favorite, but it grew on me the more I ate it. Both of these entrees came with rice. If you're concerned about eating faux meats, you can't go wrong with old-school fried tofu.   Dessert: We couldn't resist an order of the freshly fried Chinese donuts, which were nicely crisped on the outside and so soft and fluffy on the inside. It's a big order though, and hard for 2 people to finish after all the other food we ordered. I ate the rest at home with jam, but they do lose their crispness if you eat them later, FYI.

5PO4X-MKQm6-ZolvDzZOcg.text: So happy there is a vegan/vegetarian Chinese restaurant now! I got referred by a co worker and told my boyfriend about it. He went the day before me and had TWO plates by himself (that's how good it was) cashew chicken and general chicken. He said both were very good.  so me and my dad came to try.   We both got the sesame veg chicken combo with rice and spring roll. It was so good! I haven't had real chicken in forever, and it was awesome to get something other than veggies at a Chinese restaurant that was actually DELICIOUS! We will definitely be back. Best vegan Chinese food for a great price!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame veg chicken

xYwb6YpsFjH2QooXWzvFZg.text: It's refreshing to find Vegan Chinese food and close to home. This place is super yummy, there are a lot of angry past customers who miss their fried wings and other non Vegan dishes that were sold prior to the restaurants conversion to fully Vegan menu so the reviews will vary until the TRUE Vegan fan base learn about this place as angry birds will have not nice things to say.  Our toddler has never been a big meat eater he is always forced to try meat by my husband. I just have always made high Protein non meat items for him and I as prior to my Vegan conversion I was a Pescatarian 2 Days a week and a Vegetarian 5 Days a week for 10 years so I understood his no desire for meat as I didn't eat much pregnant with him (only occasional seafood).  Our son really enjoyed the Vegetarian Fried Rice which he shared with my husband both visits we've made here. He also enjoys the appetizer Lemon Fish cakes which are yummy. My husband and I always get the Spring roll appetizer as well to share. I've had the asparagus chicken which was super yummy and just recently on our latest visit I tried asparagus fish and wasn't disappointed at all. It had be same yummy light taste and flavorful which is much appreciate as people think Vegan food lacks flavor but it DOESN'T. Ooh let's not forget the Mushroom Dim Sum Vegan soup the owner gave me as she LOVES that my son LOVES Vegan food and that I'm nourishing a PlantBased baby in my tummy so she always looking out for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan Lemon Fish
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asparagus with Veg Chicken
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Fried Rice

d6VYmT_oB9J7IDCAIbUALg.text: Let me preface by saying I am a hardcore carnivore. Any meal without meat, in my mind, isn't a meal.  This. Place. Is. Amazing.  If all vegan food tasted like the food at Ma Ma Wok, I would go vegan in a heartbeat. The effort to achieve authenticity and love in each ingredient in the dishes we had were amazing! I honestly didn't know I wasn't having just plain delicious Americanized Chinese food. My wife, who is vegan, was dumbfounded that the food she was eating was 100% vegan.  Vegan or not, I cannot emphasize enough how everyone should come and try this place. Plus the service there is without a doubt some of the best, customer-centric service you can find. Super welcoming staff and obviously know how to reach more than just the vegan audience. We'd be in serious trouble if this was closer to Charlotte proper....

pQJzIfMx8uL8n2biN0q9yw.text: Full disclosure: I have never heard of or tried vegan Chinese food.  That said, I was not disappointed in the least. Food was very tasty without the often bloated taste you may get from other Chinese restaurants. Entree choices rivaled any non-vegan restaurant.   I like how the restaurant is bright with natural light. It made it a very enjoyable experience.  My only disappointment was the "pork" bun. Some things, you just have to have the real thing. But it was close to the real thing as you can get!  Pleasant experience with healthy choices

e1syYjtjVi4RZ0SfGehxFQ.text: This place is AMAZING!! We LOVE it. Had it for dinner last night and came back for lunch today. Even if you are not vegetarian, the food is outstanding.  If you are vegetarian it's out of this world.   It's wonderful. Flavorful meals that layer flavors perfectly.  My Fiance said the Thai tea was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. General Tsos Shrimp
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet and Spicy Beef and Veggies

7ZqVoUSEgsAHYw5ZEbuMAg.text: Is this real life? A vegetarian/vegan chinese restaurant?! Incredible concept that delivers! I had to look up reviews to make sure that was accurate. I had the wonton soup and sesame tofu. I understand now the difference between saying I want sesame tofu vs sesame veg meat. I will try the meat one next but I always gravitate to sesame tofu when I eat at other meat established asian places... But i also only eat chinese if they have a vegetarian option. While I am not a vegetarian I often select vegetarian choices esp with Asian restaurants. Wonton soup was very flavorful and no mystery meat in there... Really good. Sesame tofu was flavorful. Wish it had some more sauce. I drove 26 mins here for takeout and I would for sure do it again!!

8zjd9fTFUL_07L0h_p8cPw.text: Saw this restaurant as a suggestion on the nextdoor app, so thought it wouldn't hurt to give it a try. My husband and I got a carry out order(in the middle of the lunch rush) of Lo Mein and General Tso's veg meat. Both dishes were AMAZING!!! The Lo Mein is, hands down, THE BEST Lo Mein we've ever had from any Chinese restaurant in the Charlotte area. The general tso's was very tasty and quite convincing of "real" meat. It also came with a side of rice, which was moist and went great with general tso's sauce.   The service was fast and courteous. And the food was packaged neatly and still hot once we got it home. We will definitely be back to try more dishes from this unique Chinese restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. General Tso&#39;s and Lo Mein

y68vF_7uAEGknDND8y5TQg.text: After panning this little family-run restaurant a couple of years ago, this follow up was way overdue, so I stopped by today for chicken and broccoli to go. The two ladies who work out front were indeed very friendly and the food was prepared quickly and arrived piping hot.  I was particularly pleased with the perfectly cooked broccoli which arrived bright green and crunchy, instead of being overcooked like so many other places. The fried rice was also very good. The chicken however was thinly sliced, almost like lunch meat. Not that I didn't like it I mind you, it was just different.  I was also impressed with their upgraded dining room and with this 98 sanitation grade.   At a time when so many of my favorite long-time restaurants seem to be slacking off and falling by the wayside, I'm glad to see at least one going in the opposite direction.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Broccoli.
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice updated dining room.

5U1R_SoEZyEM3tQkYF1cvw.text: Yummmm!!!! My 9 year old & I really enjoyed everything about our meal!!!!! We ordered veg meat with Peking sauce, orange veg chicken, & sesame veg chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

dWNlc1OQGJOICiDH8gYLow.text: What a good little Chinese restaurant in a tucked away strip center.  Just what one would expect and love from such a place...gracious and attentive staff and very solid food!  No muss, no fuss...  The restaurant has about 6 or 7 booths surrounding the misc tables and can comfortably seat about 50.   Although my meal was simple, Kung-Po chicken, the folks around me looked like they were partaking of some great variety of choices and everyone looked quite pleased with their meals...  I will be back for the speed and quality of service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

hVqJVeUScL6uQs74KZR0Aw.text: Omg! The best Vegan food ever! It was so good, fresh! And great customer service we had pan fried dumplings, shrimp lo mein, fried rice, and chicken drumsticks. Very delightful

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire!!!!!! Thee best &#34;chicken&#34; ever

LraH3D830EVOy3jnEcLTAQ.text: OMG!!! We drove about an hour and a half to come eat and we was not disappointed!!! We had a couple appetizers and ordered 3 dishes to share and it was all amazing!!!

FNWKf1JHBM0YNgDV_oFGDg.text: this is the vest Vegan restaurant in Charlotte! The owners are very generous and talented. Everything they make is the quality and delicious ! I am enjoying going down the menu so I try everything :)  Take-out is done very well, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

EdflUj4-Kypc1ZhvuDfhGA.text: Holy Hidden Gem!  This place is a bit off the beaten path, but really holds its own since not many places can claim they are entirely vegetarian.    Super un-assuming... and easy to miss...   Small dining area.. probably five booths around the perimeter and then tables in the center of the restaurant.  The service was excellent and very polite... we didn't have a dedicated server (my guess here is it is "all hands on deck" 24/7 so everyone gets taken care of).    I was super blown away at the menu (with pictures).  It was super helpful especially since the menu still listed "chicken, beef, pork, etc"  but its not... it was almost like a magic show with food!  Probably my favorite part is that each table had a hand-drawn "recommendations" card... of which I took each of those recommendations to heart.  Ordered the fried wantons (based off the hand drawn placard) and the General Tso Tofu... came with your choice of rice.  OMG super tasty and delicious... I had a friend that ordered the BBQ Pork Buns and the Zhajiangmian noodle.  I'll let the photos speak for itself.  I'm a little bummed.. I want to keep this place a secret from the masses, but really everyone should come down here and try what Ma Ma Wok is doing.  There is also a doughnut place next door, so this shopping center has become very dangerous to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tofu!
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. fried wontons
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. bbq pork bao buns

JORZoz07tfa9P2N8wGp5sQ.text: The more I've been, the less I enjoy it. It was fun and new, but the food is just ok. The only thing I order now is beef lo mein. The distributor of the chicken cross contaminates the product with dairy, so beware of that as well.   They would improve drastically by having non-sweet sauces. They basically all taste the same so I go for whatever does not have sauce on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hunan beef. Looks greasy because I ordered it extra spicy. It was. Habanero and chili oil all over it!

Jqw48J5k28PKss1qdTVeaQ.text: This is a really nice vegan restaurant. I've never been to a vegan restaurant before and I was very happy with the food. I ordered the general tso's combo and I was very happy with the taste of the vegetable chicken. The texture needed some work because it felt a bit rubbery, but the dish overall was very nice. The ragoons were great! That was the best thing I had on the menu. I would definitely come back, if I want a vegan meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

2Yuxy7EOrcSmu1ux_i_DFw.text: Just went again today and got the Rainbow Soup and it was phenomenal!!! I recently got my wisdom teeth out so I needed something soft and was disappointed I couldn't try other things on the menu so I just got the soup. Let me just say I am SO glad i can't eat solid food and had to get the soup!!! It has an amazing flavor, texture and it's huge! I ate the whole thing in one sitting and I feel amazing. I meant to take a picture of it but I forgot cause I was so hungry. I also got the Thai tea and it was so sweet and good!! Never disappointed

cNvdyEK5UH6GgUz811kVXw.text: A great friend has been telling me about this place but I finally got to try it AND wow this is a vegetarians paradise! This is right up there with an vegetarian Indian buffet which of course the best part is you don't have to worry about what is in anything.   I announced to my entire party that I would be trying all of their food which I totally did! We started off with sticky buns which had their "ham" in it. They were a great place to start.  We tried their curry stew, cashew nut, and the sweet and spicy. The TVP that they use is well prepared which placed don't always know how to do. My meat eating friends were actually surprised by how much they enjoyed it which hopefully means I will be able to get them back.   I wish it was a closer to my house so I could get it for takeout!

0Vnsvz7IkdjL3Yg9OTpmow.text: The food is unreal! It's some of the best Chinese food I've ever had. The menu is as extensive as any Chinese restaurant which is an impressive feat for a vegan restaurant. It's a wonderful thing to be able to destroy a bunch of Chinese food and not feel like trash afterwards.   The general tsos, pork buns, Singapore noodles  and spring rolls are all amazing but try as many items as you can. Ive never been disappointed in anything here.   Also the place is clean and the staff is super nice. Atmosphere for dine-in is pretty standard for a Chinese spot in a strip mall but service and food make up for that. I think everyone should try this place. I'm blown away by this place. I eat here any time I'm in the area

ALG9nm7FD83W3-p_jDZpog.text: First time here! Thought it was a Chinese restaurant with the usual and vegan options. Hubby wouldn't even sample anything they offered lmbo! Food was delicious! Will most likely be one of my favorites when I move to the area. I had house mei fun, really good but I just wish it had more veggies. I had a spring roll, hot and sour soup and wonton soup. Loved it all, and I was stuffed afterwards! I haven't had wonton soup since I became a vegetarian 12 years ago. Staff very pleasant and helpful! Offered sample before ordering, general Tso chicken-a lil chewy but flavorful. I won't order that.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

6Fsvm3wK8NilbkxW9D6Yxg.text: Love love their vegetarian  menu !!!the curry stew and the pineapple fried rice is the bomb !

wgqsx5ZEM9QJqQocpTgpNg.text: We ordered take out a couple weeks ago. Out of the three things we ordered, I only loved one and it was their lo mein although I'd recommend adding more vegetables with it. The hot and sour soup was okay; I wouldn't order it again. And the sweet and sour chicken was weird. The meat was hard and had a strange texture. When we cut into it, it was very dark that it almost made us wonder if it was pork. Couldn't have possibly been chicken like we had ordered. I'd like to try them again but not sure I'd get anything else but their lo mein. Reminds me of the chow mein we have so much of in San Francisco.

xv1vTbKzd920UJUKJJKm6g.text: Good place for take out.  They are consistent and fast. Everyone is nice and the delivery guys are very nice as well.  I agree with Stephanie C. in that they will modify anything - which is a big plus!   I especially like their Singapore Mei Fun and if I have a hankering for fried food, I order the Sesame Chicken.

YpQkIxwZzvPGp8asfuGo-g.text: I've ordered food from the restaurant just one time.  This was the typical Chinese restaurant with 'not bad' food.  We ordered the Kung-Pao chicken (Yes, if you've read my other Chinese restaurant reviews, Kung Pao chicken is clearly my benchmark of quality) with steamed rice and a spring roll.  They prepare their meal in a relatively light sauce, somewhat runny.  It contained the typical vegetables and wasn't anything to shout about.  We did ask for it extra-hot; however, it was nothing more than spicy BBQ potato chips --and nowhere near Andy Capps hot fries.  The restaurant inside was pretty clean, and they were very efficient at making the food in the typical 5 minutes.  If I eat here again, it will only be because the Lotus Cafe down the street is closed due some freak event.

_ykv8nD8IryPxSVDnF-C4Q.text: This is clearly a take out establishment. Interior is lacking anything great, including a dated fountain machine. However, the food is good Americanized  versions of Chinese food. Like the open kitchen so after eating in I can see what's up. Kung Pao was perfect on spice but a little suacy. Fried rice on point. I'd do it agian but get it delivered...too bad I'm in uptown which is too far.

YVZxAu6UPHlr5Oz2hMKDtQ.text: Just ordered from there. Girl on the phone was nice but that was only plus. Got 3 different items and all were terrible. Chicken was rubbery and fatty. No flavor.  Sorry won't go back. All dinners thrown away

neczfOLuJaAuianftwWzRg.text: Great food, big portions, fast delivery. When i think Chinese food I think MA MA Wok

RJA8LpMjf61JQ6xU65ecog.text: Best Chinese food around.  Definitely take out rather than dine in but that's okay.  The food is terrific and the people are nice. Haven't ever been unhappy with anything we've ordered. Food is always fresh, delicious,  and hot. They now offer online ordering (very easy and convenient) and home delivery.  We've tried other Chinese restaurants over the years but always come back here. Definitely our favorite!

Rr5f4pnAbmk4EB7Rx2CrxQ.text: We just ordered food from here for the first time. It was not good at all. I upgraded my rice, which had absolutely no taste, to roast pork fried rice and I counted 5 pieces of pork in the entire order. The fried chicken wings were very salty and they took over an hour to deliver. This is the first order from them and it will be my last.

0D8Xk6B6717ZqoPFNA-19w.text: Four stars because they are a good and consistent execution of exactly what they are...an Americanized Chinese takeout place. Plus they deliver, and quickly. This is the kind of place where you'll find sticky bright red sweet and sour sauce and greasy fat lo mein noodles. That's ok, eat it and enjoy it for what it is.

NY5aeXvyqUWdYoG5Sd7eRw.text: Tried this place for the first time by placing an order for delivery. The food hadn't shown up after an hour so we called back to find out about it and the lady apologized and said it was on its way. After two hours the food still hadn't arrived. Not sure if the food is any good or not but the delivery isn't.

D_FJR6SpCkMs8EpjbJd04A.text: Always good. I am generally not a Chinese food fan but I found this place maybe a year ago and ever since I eat it regularly. I especially love the egg drop soup. We usually take it to go. Definitely great for a casual night in!

NgkWbHOVJMCKL7wnGvl-cQ.text: Ma Ma Wok is the best "fast-food" Chinese place on the Southside. Always well-cooked delicious meals, timely and friendly service. A+

7gUXCHDeN_iV54YU3DIoeA.text: Good quality. Delicious food. Great environment!! This is one of my favorite places to go eat. It's a cute, little Chinese restaurant. You can definitely taste the quality in the meats! They are also able to modify anything! From light sauce and oil to pretty much your own creative dish! My personal favorites are the chicken and broccoli, beef w/ garlic sauce, and any of their noodle dishes!

kkuSk-oWZ0L-K3FSBsLC3A.text: great Chinese food cooked and served quickly. very pleasant staff.  bare bones seating area, but they make it up in the quality and taste of the food.

qCQqZUbSV2ntI3jsfRSTmw.text: Ma Ma Wok is a jewel.  If you look around most of the other businesses in the little strip mall come and go overnight yet Ma Ma remains.  There's a reason.  The place is very well run and obviously cared for by the folks behind it.  It's always clean and things are consistently busy.  They get good food out hot and fresh.  And it's consistently excellent.  We've tried many of the dishes without a disappointment.  Some of the dishes are on par with the best Chinese food I've had (Seattle, San Francisco, Vancouver).  Most are at least on par with any other Chinese place in town.  If you're a snob, this place is not for you.  It's simple, spartan decor is about efficiency not elegance.  If you dine in you might sit between landscapers and lawyers.  And if you do dine in, or carry out, or have your food delivered, don't hesitate to ask for what you want.  They can modify most of their orders with great ease and are happy to do so.  If you are in the Blakeney area do yourself a favor and give Ma Ma a try.

-6hZ-QY5l6C7V5R5-oywOQ.text: Finally ate here and it was delicious!!! I'm vegan my boyfriend eats meat, I had the General Tso's and he had the Lo Mein. My fake meat was great and was so satisfying his Lo Mein had some awesome tasting fake chicken. I highly recommend it here, especially for vegetarians/vegans. Wish it were closer to charlotte, I'd go all the time, they were super nice and it was clean too. Great atmosphere.

ltlc6JBWIEkkQWhup8aUwg.text: Not a fan of the new menu. Chicken is beat down to flat patty's. Not enough food for the price. Flavoring not good. Miss the Egg drop soup. We were loyal customers but are sad to say good bye.

fMDkuk1IwflLE8bExuWK-g.text: Ma Ma Wok used to be a Chinese American fast food place. Since it went vegetarian, the food has been great! The dishes are freshly made with a variety of great tastes. They are actually better than many vegetarian dishes we had in China!  We are actually meat lovers.  We have eaten here twice since it became a vegetarian restaurant and will come back more trying out new dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States

uu0s5WNsZJSj9MPxPs-v7w.text: I've become a regular here because of how great it is. The service, food, and price are all worth 5 stars! The people who own and run this place are all so wonderful, and constantly smiling and being willing to accommodate their guests(take out and dine in) which feels so welcoming. Their food is stellar & I am LOVING having a full vegan menu here. The prices are on point as well & I feel like it is consistent each time. Thank you ma ma wok !!

A471QlUVY9q5DRjmb9SrcA.text: The food is amazing! It's not often you find Chinese foods that has vegan options, let alone all vegan! Friendly owner and staff, defiantly worth going!

J96UJEmfY76xCSbP0QQm_w.text: Great food! Had been disappointed with my old place so decided to give Ma Ma Wok a try. Food was great, staff was friendly and prices were very reasonable. And delivery was a big bonus. Will definetly be ordering again!

JSuBlIM-C6_TMxqO53q0zg.text: I am giving MaMa Wok 3 stars out of 5 because we have been big fans of theirs in the past, but since they have gone totally vegan I am not as big a fan any more.  I will continue to try out their dishes to find some that I like though.  Last night we ordered egg drop soup - good; won ton soup - HUGE disappointment!; spring roll - tasteless; "veggie chicken" lo mein - delicious; fried rice - tasteless.  Maybe some of their other dishes will be tastier but without the meat, it is just not the same.  I will say that it did not fill me up as much as usual and I felt like I was eating cleaner, but definitely not as tasty as in the past.

xg-Z2REy4GdKO_TQB8a9fA.text: Have been ordering delivery from here for years and we really liked it. Was disappointed they went vegetarian / vegan.  While I can see it would make sense to offer those options, eliminating meat and substituting with meat flavored alternatives seems to be a poor business choice. 6 months or less before they go out of business or go back offering real chicken, real beef, real pork.

B_4JnUvuSJK5drK2qYJs6A.text: Use to have some of the best Chinese food in charlotte. However switching to vegetarian has really brought down the quality of food. Overall the quality of food now is nowhere what it used to be. I could understand adding so vegan options, but getting rid of some of your most popular menu options has mad mama wok lose a lot of loyal customers.

ZzGRVjt7HusDrsd3ns7LCg.text: First time here ! Ordered orange chicken with fried rice, an egg roll & a diet coke. (See pic) it was VERY good . Orange chicken was sweet & crispy loved it ! It had pieces of orange peel in it .. fried rice was good . i paid $10 for everything ! Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Ma Ma Wok - Charlotte, NC, United States. Orange chicken &amp; fried rice with egg roll

erhzIaDyGfFHeaRA3QUTfA.text: 1st time there, waited for simple fired rice meal more than 10 mins while they were cleaning then the got home and ended throwing it out. Horrible!!!

Qk1LnxMJlvspjqKM0clibA.text: Called here to place an order for pickup, because lotus cafe was closed. The lady was extremely rude, inattentive and impatient. Not to mention the fact that she was coughing up a lung in my ear - every other word. She talked over me as I tried to tell her about my allergy and seemed to be in a rush. I cancelled my order due to the horrible service. Can't review the food so 2 stars for the one star service. Enjoy!

tMTOGQNN5ULNNNDvwdTsjQ.text: Came here for lunch takeout and ordered spicy shredded beef, bean curd with vegetables, fried dumplings and hot and sour soup. The shredded beef was large chunks of beef, and had a lot of onions. It tasted like beef with onions. The bean curd was fried too long. The fried dumpling didn't have any taste,and same goes for the hot and sour soup. I had to throw away most of the food. When I sat down for my order I noticed several worn shoes on the floor visible from dining room. I would not go back again.

zY8oEwc6C3C56s-fH5mP_w.text: My go-to place when I'm too lazy to cook.  Family favorite is the Singapore Mei Fun.  With the lack of authentic Asian restaurants in CLT- the Singapore Mei Fun is the closest authentic dish I'm going to get until my next trip home.  I do not recommend the crab wontons, its usually a hit or miss.  Chicken in broccoli in white sauce is another dish I order when the family is not in the mood for noodles.

fIQ4k2T4eKGY9-TIMtAdTg.text: Completely out of control order fulfillment process. Worst service. No offer of any compensation or apology.

y1mubvoMVe63G8N2-s_1KQ.text: Maybe I caught them on a bad night but this was some of the worst Chinese food I have ever had! The crab wontons were stale and all I could taste was the oil they were fried in. The sesame chicken was the same. Very very disappointed :-/

D47s9oEdY167_k1HBo9gdw.text: AWESOME!! good crunchy egg rolls good potions at lunch.right around the corner from my job and was quick. Today was my first time there let's hope next time is just as good!

hjIFC8bI87aSdgPz943vAQ.text: Yuk.  Not even one good dish.  Soggy eggrolls, watery soup, dry fried rice, General Tso's chicken was just fried with little taste.  Chow fun noodles clumped together.  Wanted this to be good so badly.  Charlotte really lacking good Chinese Food.

-xzIue-Ds_TcUYnFWHYKaA.text: They are consistently good.  We've had a few order glitches....but they deliver, they are fast, and we've only had a dish or 2 we didn't like (that was just our preference).  We order from here a few times a month when we just aren't going to cook...and too tired of pizza.

BttoB06w0VZO3dqb6vXmng.text: Not gourmet but solid every time. The folks are always very nice and the good is delicious.
